column4: PTC shares soar on EU backing for muscular dystrophy drug
column5: LONDON Shares in U.S. biotech company PTC Therapeutics more than doubled in premarket dealings on Friday after European regulators recommended a conditional marketing authorization for Translarna  its drug for Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

column4: UPDATE 1-Panasonic aims to be sole producer in Tesla's U.S. mega-factory
column5: * Will spend more than double budget on auto batteries this year   (Adds quotes from executive  background of companies' relationship  details on Panasonic strategy)

column4: Panasonic to spend double original capex plan on auto batteries this year- exec
column5: OSAKA  May 23 Panasonic Corp expects to spend over 28 billion yen ($275 million) on capex into its auto batteries this year  twice its confirmed budget  with some to be invested into lithium-ion batteries for Tesla Motor Inc's  electric vehicles.

column4: Panasonic wants to be sole battery cell maker at Tesla project -exec
column5: OSAKA  Japan  May 23 Panasonic Corp  wants to be the exclusive producer of lithium-ion battery cells at U.S. electric car maker Tesla Motors Inc's planned multibillion-dollar battery factory  a senior executive of the Japanese company said on Friday.

column4: European Factors to Watch-Shares seen steady  focus on elections
column5: (Adds futures prices  company news)     LONDON  May 23 European shares are expected to open steady on Friday  with investors seen avoiding strong bets ahead of Ukrainian and European election results.     At 0625 GMT  futures for the Euro STOXX 50  Britain's FTSE 100   Germany's DAX and France's CAC were flat to 0.09 percent lower.     Investors will keep a close eye on Ukraine  where more than a dozen servicemen were reported killed on Thursday in a clash with pro-Russian separatist

column4: Cemex takes broadly upbeat view of Holcim  Lafarge merger
column5: MEXICO CITY  May 23 Mexican cement maker Cemex  said on Friday it expected the planned merger between its rivals Lafarge SA and Holcim Ltd  to be broadly positive for the industry  and is open to exploring acquisitions that may result from it.

column4: Bottler Coca-Cola HBC sees slower volume growth in Russia
column5: RADZYMIN  Poland  May 23 Coca-Cola HBC (CC HBC)    the world's No. 2 bottler of Coca-Cola Co  drinks  expects volume growth in Russia to slow to "mid single digits" in 2014  the firm's chief executive said.

column4: Exclusive: Goldman's Cohn takes on Washington to defend commodities
column5: NEW YORK Sen. Sherrod Brown  a Democrat from Ohio  and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. President Gary Cohn  who's from Cleveland  are friendly enough that Brown has been known to rib Cohn for abandoning the Cleveland Indians baseball team in favor of the New York Yankees. The two men first met years ago  and Cohn and his family  who are also Democrats  have contributed to Brown's campaigns.

column4: Coca-Cola to launch 'glacéau smartwater' in Britain
column5: Coca Cola  is expected to launch a new product - "glacéau smartwater" - in Britain  aimed at the country's 1.4 billion pound ($2.4 billion) bottled water market  a decade after its Dasani brand failed in the region  The Times reported on Friday.

column4: Deutsche Bank won't fund Australia coal port expansion near reef
column5: MELBOURNE  May 23 Germany's largest bank  Deutsche Bank AG  has declared it will not finance a controversial coal port expansion in Australia near the Great Barrier Reef  responding to calls from green groups and tourism operators.

column4: FirstEnergy Beaver 2 reactor back online after refueling outage
column5: May 23 FirstEnergy Corp's 904-megawatt Unit 2 at the Beaver Valley nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania returned to service on Friday after the startup was interrupted on Tuesday because of a problem with a steam generator while it was preparing to exit a refueling outage.

column4: Exclusive: Goldman's Cohn takes on Washington to defend commodities
column5: NEW YORK Sen. Sherrod Brown  a Democrat from Ohio  and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. President Gary Cohn  who's from Cleveland  are friendly enough that Brown has been known to rib Cohn for abandoning the Cleveland Indians baseball team in favor of the New York Yankees. The two men first met years ago  and Cohn and his family  who are also Democrats  have contributed to Brown's campaigns.

column4: Thai unrest spurs Honda unit to cut output and delay new plant
column5: BANGKOK The Thai unit of Honda Motor Co  has cut production at its Ayutthaya plant to 60 percent of capacity to reflect weak domestic demand  voicing concerns sales may fall short of its target this year after months of political unrest.

column5: NEW YORK  May 23 The S&P 500 closed at a record on Friday  boosted by a better-than-expected reading on the housing market  which gave a lift to homebuilding stocks. Hewlett-Packard's stock  which was the S&P 500's best performer  rallied a day after the personal computer maker reported results and said it may cut up to 16 000 jobs.

column4: U.S. Senate panel backs plan for alternative to Russian rocket engine
column5: COLORADO SPRINGS  Colo. The U.S. Senate Armed Services Committee on Thursday approved a plan that would add $100 million to the U.S. military budget to start work on a new U.S. rocket engine and eliminate reliance on a Russian-made engine used to lift big government satellites into orbit.
